parse.title: List of active separatist movements in North America

text.*:
This article needs additional citations for verification. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. (March 2008) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)

This is a list of currently active separatist movements in North America. Separatism includes autonomism and secessionism. What is and is not considered an autonomist or secessionist movement is sometimes contentious. Entries on this list must meet three criteria:

  1. They are active movements with living, active members.
  2. They are seeking greater autonomy or self-determination for a geographic region.
  3. They are the citizen/peoples of the conflict area and do not come from other countries.

Under each region listed is one or more of the following:

  • De facto state: for regions with de facto autonomy from the government
  • Proposed state: proposed name for a seceding sovereign state
  • Proposed autonomous area: for movements toward greater autonomy for an area but not outright secession
    • De facto autonomous government: for governments with de facto autonomous control over a region
    • Government-in-exile: for a government based outside of the region in question, with or without control
    • Political party (or parties): for political parties involved in a political system to push for autonomy or secession
    • Militant organisation(s): for armed organisations (sometimes called terrorist organisations)
    • Advocacy group(s): for non-belligerent, non-politically participatory entities
    • Ethnic/ethno-religious/racial/regional/religious group(s)

Contents

  • 1 Canada
  • 2 Denmark
  • 3 Mexico
  • 4 Nicaragua
  • 5 United States
    • 5.1 Territories
    • 5.2 Other
  • 6 French Overseas Departments
  • 7 Saint Kitts and Nevis
  • 8 Trinidad and Tobago
  • 9 See also
  • 10 References

Canada[edit]

Main article: Secessionist movements of Canada

Alberta

Main article: Alberta separatism
  • Proposed state: Alberta

British Columbia + Pacific Northwestern US

Main article: Cascadia (independence movement)
  • Proposed state: Cascadia

Newfoundland and Labrador

Main article: Secessionist movements of Canada § Newfoundland & Labrador
  • Proposed State: Newfoundland and Labrador

Nova Scotia

Main article: Secessionist movements of Canada § Nova Scotia
  • Proposed State: Nova Scotia or merge with the  United States

Quebec

Main article: Quebec sovereignty movement
Secessionist movements
  • Regional group: Québécois people
  • Proposed state: Québec
  • Civil organization: Saint-Jean-Baptiste Society, Mouvement national des Québécois et des Québécoises (MNQ), Rassemblement pour l'indépendance du Québec (RIQ), Les Intellectuels pour la souveraineté (IPSO), Mouvement de libération nationale du Québec (MLNQ), Réseau de Résistance du Québecois (RRQ)
  • Labour union: Confédération des syndicats nationaux (CSN), Centrale des syndicats du Québec (CSQ), Fédération des travailleurs du Québec (FTQ), Union des artistes (UDA)
  • Political party: Parti Québécois, Bloc Québécois, Québec solidaire, Parti indépendantiste, Option nationale
Autonomist movements
  • Proposed autonomous area: Québec
  • Political party: Coalition Avenir Québec
  • Parliamentary group: Québec debout

Vancouver Island

  • Proposed autonomous area: Province of Vancouver Island
  • Political party: Vancouver Island Party

Inuit autonomist movements:

  • Nunavut, Nunavik, Nunatsiavut, NunatuKavut, and Inuvik Region

Denmark[edit]

For other movements in Denmark, see List of active separatist movements in Europe.

Greenland is geographically part of North America, but is politically connected to Europe.

Greenland

Main article: Greenlandic independence
  • Ethnic group: Greenlandic Inuit
  • Proposed state:  Greenland
  • Political party: Inuit Ataqatigiit, Forward, and Inuit Party

Mexico[edit]

Zapatista (Chiapas)

  • Ethnic group: Chiapas Mayas
  • De facto autonomous area: Rebel Zapatista Autonomous Municipalities
  • Political parties: Council of Good Government
  • Militant organization: Zapatista Army of National Liberation

Nicaragua[edit]

Mosquito

  • Ethnic group: Miskito people
  • Proposed state: Communitarian Nation of Moskitia

United States[edit]

California

  • Proposed state: Second Californian Republic/"New" California
  • Pressure groups: Yes California,[1] Californians for Independence[2]
  • Political party: California National Party[3]

Cascadia (including Washington, Oregon, and the Canadian province of British Columbia)

Main article: Cascadia (independence movement)
  • Proposed state: Cascadia
  • Pressure group: Cascadia Independence Movement

Hawaii[4]

Main article: Hawaiian sovereignty movement
  • Ethnic group: Native Hawaiians
  • Pressure groups: Nation of Hawaiʻi, Office of Hawaiian Affairs
  • Political party: Hawaii Independence Party

New England

  • Ethnic group: New Englanders
  • Pressure groups: New England Independence Campaign[5]

New Hampshire

  • Proposed state: New Hampshire
  • Pressure groups: Foundation for New Hampshire Independence[6]
  • Political parties: New Hampshire Liberty Party[7]

Texas

Main article: Texas secession movements
  • Proposed state: Republic of Texas
  • Pressure groups: Texas Nationalist Movement,[8] Republic of Texas organization (defunct)

Vermont

  • Proposed state: Vermont Republic restoration
  • Political party: Vermont Independence Party[9][10]
  • Pressure group: Second Vermont Republic and the Green Mountain Anarchist Collective

Territories[edit]

Puerto Rico

Main article: Independence movement in Puerto Rico
  • Cultural group: Puerto Rican people
  • Proposed state:  Republic of Puerto Rico
  • Political party: Puerto Rican Independence Party (PIP)
  • Pressure group: Puerto Rican Nationalist Party, Movimiento Independentista Nacional Hostosiano (MINH), Socialist Front (FS)
  • Militant organization: Boricua Popular Army (Macheteros)

Other[edit]

Confederate States of America

Main article: Neo-Confederate
  • Proposed state: Confederate States of America or Southern United States
  • Pressure groups: League of the South, Southern Party (defunct), Identity Dixie[11]

French Overseas Departments[edit]

Martinique

  • Proposed state: Republic of Martinique
  • Political party: Martinican Progressive Party, Martinican Independence Movement

Saint Kitts and Nevis[edit]

 Nevis

  • Proposed state: Nevis
  • Political party: Nevis Reformation Party, Concerned Citizens Movement

Trinidad and Tobago[edit]

 Tobago

  • Proposed state: Tobago
  • Political party: Democratic Action Congress

See also[edit]

  • List of active separatist movements
  • List of historical separatist movements

References[edit]

  1. ^ http://www.yescalifornia.org/
  2. ^ http://CaforIndependence.co
  3. ^ https://californianational.party
  4. ^ Hawaii is not geographically in the continent of North America, but is politically part of it.
  5. ^ http://newenglandindependence.weebly.com/
  6. ^ http://nhindependence.org/about-us/
  7. ^ http://nhliberty.info/platform/
  8. ^ http://www.thetnm.org/
  9. ^ Vt. Independence Party to meet in Montpelier, WCAX-TV News, September 12, 2012.
  10. ^ Vermont Independence Party convention, Seven Days newspaper, September 2012.
  11. ^ https://identitydixie.com/
